title: A Handcrafted Hot Rod Honors a Patriarch
text:
Armando Pedroza of Montebello, Calif., 38, a cargo-shipping coordinator, on his Don Challo hot rod, as told to A.J. Baime.

About five years ago, we were having a family barbecue at my house when the idea came up: Wouldn’t it be cool to build a hot rod? We came up with the idea to build a car as a tribute to my grandfather, José Rosario Pedroza. He was born in Mexico and he went through a lot of hardship. He is the pride of our family and the reason we are all here in America. We call him Don Challo. (Don is a term of respect,...
description: To pay tribute to their Mexican-born relative, members of a California family took a 1927 Ford Model T body and created a smoke-breathing vehicle with ‘Mad Max’ flair.
